org.flixel.plugin.DebugPathDisplay

type
class
extends
org.flixel.FlxBasic
A simple manager for tracking and drawing FlxPath debug data to the screen.

Constructor

public new()
Instantiates a new debug path display manager.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

public ID : Int

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

private _paths : Array<org.flixel.FlxPath>

private _tween : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public active : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

public alive : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

public autoClear : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
If the Tweener should clear on removal. For Entities, this is when they are removed from a World, and for World this is when the active World is switched.

public cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

public exists : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() and draw() are automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

public hasTween(getTween,null) : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

public visible : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

public add(Path : org.flixel.FlxPath) : Void

Add a path to the path debug display manager. Usually called automatically by FlxPath's constructor.
Parameters:
Path - The FlxPath you want to add to the manager.

public addTween(t : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween, ?start : Bool) : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public clear() : Void

Removes all the paths from the path debug display manager.

public clearTweens() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public destroy() : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxBasic
Clean up memory.

public draw() : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxBasic
Called by FlxG.drawPlugins() after the game state has been drawn. Cycles through cameras and calls drawDebug() on each one.

public drawDebug(?Camera : org.flixel.FlxCamera) : Void

overrides org.flixel.FlxBasic
Similar to FlxObject's drawDebug() functionality, this function calls drawDebug() on each FlxPath for the specified camera. Very helpful for debugging!
Parameters:
Camera - Which FlxCamera object to draw the debug data to.

private getTween() : Bool

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public kill() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

public postUpdate() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Post-update is called right after update() on each object in the game loop.

public preUpdate() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Pre-update is called right before update() on each object in the game loop.

public remove(Path : org.flixel.FlxPath) : Void

Remove a path from the path debug display manager. Usually called automatically by FlxPath's destroy() function.
Parameters:
Path - The FlxPath you want to remove from the manager.

public removeTween(t : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween) : org.flixel.tweens.FlxTween

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic

public revive() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

public toString() : String

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

public update() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to update your class's position and appearance. This is where most of your game rules and behavioral code will go.

public updateTweens() : Void

inherited from org.flixel.FlxBasic
